verses.name: Psalms 7:1
verses.text: O Lord my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

verses.name: Psalms 7:2
verses.text: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

verses.name: Psalms 7:3
verses.text: O Lord my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

verses.name: Psalms 7:4
verses.text: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

verses.name: Psalms 7:5
verses.text: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 7:6
verses.text: Arise, O Lord, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

verses.name: Psalms 7:7
verses.text: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

verses.name: Psalms 7:8
verses.text: The Lord shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

verses.name: Psalms 7:9
verses.text: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

verses.name: Psalms 7:10
verses.text: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 7:11
verses.text: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

verses.name: Psalms 7:12
verses.text: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

verses.name: Psalms 7:13
verses.text: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

verses.name: Psalms 7:14
verses.text: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

verses.name: Psalms 7:15
verses.text: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

verses.name: Psalms 7:16
verses.text: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

verses.name: Psalms 7:17
verses.text: I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord most high.
